newsitem.title: CHINA: China's Tibet output value grows 10 pct in 1996.
newsitem.headline: China's Tibet output value grows 10 pct in 1996.

text.p: Output value of China's remote Tibet region grew by 10 percent in 1996 to hit 6.45 billion yuan ($777 million), the Xinhua news agency said on Sunday.
Gross industrial output value of the backward region reached 668 million yuan in 1996, a 15.8 percent increase from the year before, Xinhua said.
Incomes of farmers and herdsmen, who make up the majority of the Himalayan region's 2.3 million people, rose by 9.3 percent, while urban incomes soared by 25.9 percent, the agency said.
Rural per capita incomes were about 600 yuan a year in 1995, while urban incomes neared 2,000 yuan, official figures show.
Total foreign trade of the region rose 65.2 percent in 1996 to hit $116.5 million, it said, without giving a breakdown of imports and exports.
Grain output was seen up seven percent last year to reach 770,000 tonnes, it said, but gave no further details.
